label: Description
value: With corners disposed on vertical and horizontal axes, the backplate is pierced and wrought to form quadranted design of grooved foliations. Its brad receives the spatulate open drop handle, flattened at the bottom to form one interior and one exterior point.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Anonymous Donor
Modo de Volar (A Way of Flying), plate 13 in Disparates (Proverbs)

label: Description
value: Multiple views of a man attached to a winged flying apparatus with the head of a bird. Each view shows the user and apparatus from a different angle and type of flying motion.

label: Physical description
value: Aquatint and etching on white wove paper

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Otras Leyes por El Pueblo (Other Laws for the People)

label: Description
value: A large elephant stands at right, facing left, partially outlined against an oval area of light. In the shadows, at the lower left, stands a group of four men, one holding up an open book, another a collar of bells. Printed by Francois Liénard, in the French magazine “L’Art,” 1877, Vol. II, p. 40. Prepared in ca. 1815 for the Los Proverbios (Proverbs) series but not printed/published until later.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. W. Erickson, New York, NY; 1951: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Ornament with the Man of Sorrows, Mary and John

label: Description
value: A panel with the Virgin and Saint John standing at the foot of the Cross with the Virgin and Child, and angels above.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. A. W. Erickson; 1951: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Fragment of a garment knitted in deep blue and white thick cotton yarn, with broad bands of geometric pattern separated by narrow bands of Kufic script repeating the name of Allah.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: knitting, stockinette stitch Label: knitted cotton

label: Description
value: Fragment of black, weft-ribbed silk cut at the bottom into three wide shallow scallops, in turn scalloped, with applied section of bottle green velvet; double row of couched gold cord outlining velvet and encircling applied faceted green glass sequins.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal, glass; section of dress-trimming Technique: cloth with velvet applique, couched gold cord, glass sequins

label: Description
value: Small piece of firmly woven cloth in shades of green that vary from blue-green to yellow-green. Slubs and variations in the yarn thickness.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: raw silk Technique: plain weave; Z-twist warp and weft

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 7.5 x 37 cm (2 15/16 x 14 9/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Large complete coverlet in navy blue wool and white cotton with two central wreaths enclosing an eight-pointed star. Surrounding these are an array of floral and bird motifs including eagles with wings spread and clutching banners, scrolling acanthus leaves, a small building with cupola, and pairs of reindeer. Date on coverlet appears to read 1855.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, cotton Technique: double cloth

label: Description
value: Indo-European figural groups, plant and animal combinations, in large lobed medallions in horizontal-vertical arrangement on a ground filled with small figures, floral motives, birds and animals. In coarse yellow silk chain stitch on undyed cotton ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, tussah silk Technique: chain stitch embroidery

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 200 x 136.5 cm (6 ft. 6 3/4 in. x 53 3/4 in.)

label: Description
value: Border of fine muslin with an elaborate design in drawnwork and embroidery in imitation of lace. Also known as "dentelles de Saxe."

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: deflected element work

label: Provenance
value: Given to Mrs. Litte by E. Huber, cousin of Fred Iklé.

label: Description
value: Strapwork and stylized foliation, similar to tile work or ashlar block design.  Printed in green, gray, and black on pale off-white ground.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. Charles P. Morgan

label: Description
value: White satin ribbon band or border probably from the bottom edge of a robe with ornamentation in appliqué of silks, velvet and pailettes. Design of converging S-scrolls, sprays of foliage or petal forms in painted silk in between and leaf shapes in ribbed velvet. Colors are cream and purple with flecks of color on leaf sprays. Remains of metal thread outline on some leaves. Purple and white braid on bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, painted silk, metallic thread, metal pailettes Technique: embroidery and appliqué

label: Description
value: Cream-colored panel embroidered with pastel silks and touches of black with large central design of big and small dragons with flaming pearl and fish in delicate cloud and water conventions. Enclosing border set in from edge of smaller dragons, lotus, and flaming pearl. Deep knotted tan silk fringe. Lined with pongee.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: embroidery on plain satin weave

label: Description
value: The prodigal son as a swineherd. He is seen in profile, facing right, and represented praying on his knees, his hands clasped together. Before him a group of pigs are eating from a trough. Houses in background.

label: Description
value: At left a young woman stands, accompanied by a savage man, who caresses her. His staff holds a strap which supports an escutcheon with a helmet crested by wings, ornamented with curling drapery and a shield containing a skull.

label: Description
value: Section of toweling in undyed linen. Two plain cloth selvedges. Raw edges on top and bottom with overcast linen thread at top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: hand woven plain weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Section of toweling in undyed linen. Two plain cloth selvedges. Raw edge at top and narrow hand hem at bottom.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: hand woven plain weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Section of a white table napkin with a broad allover chevron and diamond pattern. Borders have rows of elongated hexagons. Narrow hand hem with linen thread on all sides.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: hand woven plain weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Length of undyed linen toweling with small overshot pattern. Two cloth selvedges. Narrow hand hem top and bottom in linen thread.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: linen Technique: plain weave with supplementary weft patterning

label: Description
value: Semi-circular cape with a central square flanked by two wedge shapes and framed by multiple borders, all filled with a variety of fantastic and naturalistic birds, animals, and hunters on horses or elephants. In golden tan Tussah silk in fine chain stitch with outline and knot stitch fillings and accents on cotton ground, now mellowed to a light brown color, and covered with a fine scrolling leaf pattern in same silk in outline stitch. Similar cotton backing caught in with some of the quilting and major areas of embroidery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: S-spun tussah silk embroidery, Z-spun cotton foundation Technique: embroidered in chain and back stitch with French knots on two layers of plain weave; inner layer of unspun cotton Label: cotton embroidered with tussah silk in chain and back stitch with French knots

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Elizabeth Haynes

label: Description
value: Reads: "5 Dollars/Reward-/Lost between the CANAL BRIDGE AT/PORT SCHUYLER and the PATROON'S BRIDGE, a/BAND BOX / containing LADIES' AND CHILDREN'S WEARING APPAREL 9etc., etc.) Dated: Albany, July 28, 1835."

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Mrs. Charles S. Fairchild and Eleanor G. Hewitt

label: Description
value: The excavation is in the foreground. Behind it are a group of tall buildings, outlined against the sky. Near center, a building surmounted by a dome (World Building); to its right, the building with tower and peaked roof (Tribune Building), and low-domed building, right (N.Y. Post Office).

label: Physical description
value: Etching in black ink on laid paper

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Sarah Cooper Hewitt

label: Description
value: Long panel with chiné warp blazes forming large-scale symmetric vertical repeat of floral forms in scalloped continuous ogival framework in shades of green, blue, pink and brown on undyed silk ground. Two narrow plain selvedges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: warp printed plain weave

label: Description
value: Long panel with chiné warp blazes forming large-scale symmetric vertical repeat of floral forms in scalloped continuous ogival framework in shades of green, blue, pink and brown on undyed silk ground. Two narrow plain selvedges.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: warp printed plain weave

label: Description
value: Panels from a skirt made of lightweight taffeta with chiné warp producing Louis XV design of vertical bands, each containing large serpentining floral band with small floral form dropping from each outward curve below, and each set off by guard bands. Greens, yellows, corals, brown, mauve on an undyed ground.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: warp printed plain weave

label: Description
value: Pair of earrings of hairi-work woven into spherical and cylindrical forms, mounted in gold.

label: Description
value: Mughal-style embroidery for the export market. Section of a guard border with two continuous shaded lines forming lobed medallions that alternate with small diamond shapes. Medallions have blue and orange flowers inside, and the small diamonds have red flowers that radiate out on two points. One edge has a straight border in shades of orange, yellow and blue while the opposite edge has a scalloped border in dark purple.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk Technique: chain stitch embroidery on twill weave

label: Description
value: Small section of a coverlet or hanging showing parts of delicately drawn twining stems, leaves, flowers, symmetrical leaf volutes, and graduated dots, in shades of purple, red, blue, yellow, orange, and green silk embroidered on an undyed ground with a small diamond-shaped diaper pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk Technique: chain stitch embroidery on twill weave

label: Description
value: Vertical curtain panel with four broad vertical bands; each filled with a single broad serpentine band in shaded blue with a small blaze in each scallop and with a straight narrow pale blue stripe on each side. All formed by blue ikat in the warp direction.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen Technique: resist printed warp (ikat) on plain weave

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Jacques Séligmann
